title: Alternatives to Franklin Gothic, Trade Gothic, and News Gothic
content:
I like fonts like Franklin, Trade and News Gothic a lot. But i think they are all used to much.

Do you know some fresh Alternatives.
author: jawbox

comments.content:
Some more...

[Champion Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/champion/index.html)  
 [Knockout Series](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/index.html)  
 [MT Grotesque 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=242763&grab_id=0&page_id=11995&query=MT%20Grotesque) & [2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=243187&grab_id=0&page_id=12024&query=MT%20Grotesque) Not exactly fresh but I love it.

You're exactly right. They are overused. Geoff lists some good, underplayed alternatives. Also:

[Griffith Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=griffith%20gothic)  
 [Spiegel](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FK.112464.0.0)  
 [FF Unit](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=unit)  
 [Katarine](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en&section=font&font=katarine)

National, Parry Grotesque, the up coming Capone from CakeType.com

Skopex Gothic is an outstanding take

Wow, 2 years old. While we're at it:

[Brown Gothic 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/shinntype/brown_gothic/) and [2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/shinntype/brown_gothic_2/)  
 [Bulldog](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/bulldog_vp/)  
 [Monotype Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/monotype_grotesque_std_by_adobe_complete_vp/)

Hello Mike,

Capone is renamed to Eminio (the brother of Al Capone), because there already is a Capone Light from Monotype.  
Thanks for mentioning!

Pieter

Pieter, thank you for the correction. :-)

I love your work, especially the KPN designs.

Whitney has a very similar feel to News Gothic:

[http://typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100026](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100026 "http://typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100026")

In this vein, I've long admired Mario Feliciano's Grotzec, but I haven't had occasion to license it or try it out.

[http://www.vllg.com/Feliciano/GrotzecHeadlineCondensed/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.vllg.com/Feliciano/GrotzecHeadlineCondensed/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://www.vllg.com/Feliciano/GrotzecHeadlineCondensed/mudTyper+Weights/")

_Wow, 2 years old._

And forward two years more...

_While we're at it:  
Brown Gothic 1 and 2  
Bulldog  
Monotype Grotesque_

Thanks, Stephen. Bullbog is MiA, but both Brown and Grotesque look delicious.

Any new suggestions, perhaps? :)

An alternate to Franklin, News and Trade Gothic? Perhaps [_Alternate_ Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=T1166)?

Bah dum shhh!

Here's [Bulldog](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/clubtype/bulldog/?refby=typographica) (it's no longer available from Creative Alliance, only direct from Club Type, the source foundry). See also [this list at FontShop](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/alternatives/trade_gothic/?affid=99346).

Benton Sans, a real workhorse, and to me, kind of the terminus of those lines of typographic thought.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224214im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bentonsans_4125.gif)
Trevor - thanks for your contribution but you'll notice Benton is mentioned above.
